overview:
Will’s company, AUDIOis Inc., created SpokenLayer, an application designed to let people “Read with their Ears.” Taking articles from across the web, SpokenLayer transforms written stories into audio stories within seconds, using speech synthesis, professional voices, and crowd-sourced readers. In what used to be the sole domain of the written word, SpokenLayer seeks to give voice to the web, making it possible to hear the latest news and information.

Will’s Masters in Computer Engineering with a concentration in Product Design, his undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering, and his commitment to sound, music, and singing, have conspired to give Will a unique perspective on the digital audio world. Will has worked professionally at Intel, where he designed server processor internals, and Goldman Sachs, where he produced new visualization and analysis technologies for traders on the floor of the NYSE. In 2009 he taught “Principles of Engineering Design” at the Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth and worked in Apple Retail where he was a Mac Specialist, Visual Assistant, and Computer Imaging expert.
